column4: Let's say I want to move a game file, like a user made map, to an installed game. When I drag it to the destination folder for the game, it says I don't have the administrative control to do that. How do I allow my user to move files?
ok
jest extract where ever you want.
what game are you tryign to install?
I've already installed Battle for Wesnoth using the software center
I'm simply trying to add a usermade map to its files
just find the maps folder
its probably hidden in your home.
open nautilus and hit ctrl+h to show the hidden files.  Or find otu where you are supposed to put homemade maps.
ya...the maps folder is in usr/share/games/wesnoth/data/multiplayer/scenarios
but it wont let me drag the file there
Error moving file: Permission denied
open a terminal and sudo cp filename /usr/share/games/wesnorth/data/multiplayer/scenarios
when you say "home" what are you referring to? where is my "home?"
or alt+f2 and gksu nautilus
do the last suggeston alt+f2 and type in gksu nautilus and hit enter. That will give youa root file browser
/home/desciero  or whatever your username is on the box /home/username
did that and all it brings up is a desktop
does it say root filebrowser at the top?
go up a folder
browse to where you saved the map file probably in /home/username somewhere.
and copy and paste it where you need to.  Or drag from antoher window
the problem is not finding the file...it is not being able to get that file to where it needs to go
and it needs to go somewhere I don't have access to
